document.full_text: babies born to women who take corticosteroid drugs for asthma or other chronic ills may not have a heightened risk of birth defects known as oral clefts, a study published monday suggests.
document.title: steroid medications not tied to oral birth defects
lines_and_colors: babies born to women who take corticosteroid drugs for asthma or other chronic ills may not have a heightened risk of birth defects known as oral clefts, a study published monday suggests.
